titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Marilyn Murphy Papers LSC.2226
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stacy Wood, 2014; Sabrina Ponce, 2018

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 22 February 2018.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-15 17:08:04 -0700.

did.abstract: Marilyn Murphy was a lesbian activist and author. She had a long-running column, "Lesbian Logic," in Lesbian News in the 1980s and a selection of her columns appeared in the 1991 book, Are You Girls Traveling Alone? She was an active member of the organization Old Lesbians Organizing for Change (OLOC) and the Califia Community along with Diane F. Germain. The collection consists of several of Murphy's published and unpublished works, including a copy of her book, as well as correspondence, ephemera, and audiovisual materials.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This collection contains processed audiovisual materials. All requests to access digital materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Marilyn Murphy Papers (Collection 2226). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: June Mazer Lesbian Archives, transfer, 2012. Original provenance unknown.
This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Processed by Stacy Wood, 2014. Additional processing by Sabrina Ponce, 2018.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

odd.head: Sponsor
odd.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Marilyn Murphy was a lesbian activist and author. She had a long-running column, "Lesbian Logic," in Lesbian News in the 1980s and a selection of her columns appeared in the 1991 book, Are You Girls Traveling Alone? She was an active member of the organization Old Lesbians Organizing for Change (OLOC) and the Califia Community along with Diane F. Germain. Murphy died in 2004 and is survived by her partner, Irene Weiss, co-founder of the Califia Community.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of several of Murphy's published and unpublished works, including a copy of her book Are You Girls Traveling Alone?, as well as correspondence, ephemera, and audiovisual materials.

list.item: Diane Germain Papers (Collection 1961). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.
Old Lesbians Organizing for Change Records (Collection 2203). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

controlaccess.subject: Lesbian activists -- United States -- Archives.
controlaccess.corpname: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Flyer for a personal fundraiser and a resolution drafted for the Los Angeles chapter of NOW (National Organization for Women.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Articles, drafts and duplicates written by Marilyn Murphy for various lesbian and feminist publications. Includes articles published in various edited volumes and publications such as United Sisters Magazine and New Directions for Women.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Essays, drafts, duplicates and corrections of articles written by Marilyn Murphy for various lesbian publications such as Off the Rag: Lesbians Writing on Menopause and The Presence of Others: Readings for Critical Thinking and Writing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Marilyn Murphy and friends as well as from admirers of her work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A copy of Marilyn Murphy's book Are You Traveling Alone?

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Hard copies of emails coordinating memorial services for Marilyn Murphy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes a promotional towel for the program The L Word and two buttons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes three audiocassettes, two MiniDV cassettes, and four videocassettes documenting activities of the Califia community, Murphy's life history, and interviews among other recordings.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
